oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Historic home residence “Alamo,” Nashville, Tennessee, 1911
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The residence of Mr. and Mrs. John M. Gaut, known as the “Alamo.” The home was located on Murfreesboro Pike, on land granted by the State of North Carolina in 1793, to Thomas Hardiman. It was during the American Civil War that a large body of Federal soldiers encamped upon the land, with a spring house nearby. This digital photo is reproduced from the book “Historical and Beautiful Country Homes Near Nashville,” compiled by Mrs. James E. Caldwell and published in 1911. 1 digital photo, title supplied by cataloger.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gaut family; Hardiman family
